file_content.text: I heard you had a run-in with that jerk, Kiregan Freem. Glad somebody put him in his place.
I'm throwing in a little bonus. You went above and beyond.
Just doing my job.
Happy to help.
I don't expect any more gangs will mess with the Empire for a while.
It's the least you can do.
The point is, I'm grateful to have those Exchange jerks out of my hair.
Take out the gunners and the comm jammers and call in the reinforcements.
My lord. You cut a frightening profile on the dunes, don't you? I mean to say, I'm honored.
My lord. Not often we see Sith in the middle of nowhere. Not a critique, mind you.
You. You're not Exchange, are ya?
Hunter. Have a minute to spare? Got a problem, and you look like the solution.
Captain Dimitrius. The Exchange has been interrupting our shipments lately. We tell them to stop on pain of death, but they don't listen.
I need somebody to check their hearing, if you know what I mean.
Fear and intimidation are what I do best.
You want me to frighten them.
I believe it.
You want me to bash their heads in.
You mean, rough them up.
I want to dismantle their operation piece by rotting piece.
I'm not a lackey, and I don't do brutish work.
Do I look like a thug?
If this was brute's work, I would've done it myself. Needs finesse.
I prefer not to make uneducated guesses. That's how mistakes get made.
Be explicit.
You're smart. I like you.
What's your plan?
I don't.
I need you to make good on our promise to shove their ships down their throats.
I got a bead on the Exchange's shipping warehouse. The locus of their whole operation. I want to scrape them off the map.
But it's guarded by anti-air guns and comm jammers that make a large-scale attack impossible to coordinate.
Give me a shot, and I'll disable the guns and the jammers.
Leave it to me.
Good thought, but we want those guns intact for when we move in.
That's a pretty sophisticated operation the Exchange is running.
Fancy equipment.
No kidding. Maybe this little run will give us some idea who's backing them.
What's the job?
I need you to take out the gunners, take out the jammers, and then call in the reinforcements.
Sounds easy enough.
I'd be happy to help.
I knew when I saw you, you were the fix I needed.
The warehouse is close by. Can't miss it; everything else is sand.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
This isn't grunts' work. I hope you'll reconsider.
Things are getting better out here.
